title: Systems & Platforms
text:
I design and build technology platforms that address real, unsolved problems in research management, clinical trial operations, and health data. These systems are built to be institutionally adoptable and scalable.



Catalyst
Research Information Management System (RIMS)
A comprehensive platform for managing researcher profiles, tracking grants across their lifecycle, and generating strategic dashboards for institutional decision-making. Catalyst consolidates fragmented research data into a single operational layer.


Researcher profile management
Grant tracking and lifecycle monitoring
Strategic analytics dashboards
Institutional reporting


Status: Production development. Project manager hired. Weekly development cycles.


Metricis
Metrics & Analytics Platform
Purpose-built analytics platform supporting the Refocus Clinical Trials initiative. Metricis provides real-time metrics on trial activity, site performance, and research portfolio health across Alberta.


Clinical trial performance metrics
Site activity monitoring
Portfolio analytics
Benchmarking dashboards


Status: Active development. Integrated with Refocus Clinical Trials.


AegisText / Janus
AI-Powered Text Analysis Platform
An NLP pipeline for analyzing clinical and research documents at scale. AegisText handles document ingestion and classification; Janus provides the natural language processing engine for entity extraction, summarization, and pattern detection.


Clinical document analysis
Entity extraction and classification
AI-assisted protocol review
Text summarization at scale


Status: Active development. Demo AI-driven protocol session completed.


Compass
Strategic Navigation & Decision Support
A decision-support tool for research leaders navigating complex institutional landscapes. Compass synthesizes project data, timelines, and strategic priorities to surface what matters most.


Strategic priority mapping
Project dependency visualization
Decision-support recommendations
Portfolio risk assessment


Status: Active development. Project manager hiring in progress.


BeTheCure-Match
Clinical Trial Matching Platform
A patient-facing platform that matches individuals to relevant clinical trials based on their clinical profile, location, and eligibility criteria. Designed to improve trial recruitment and reduce barriers to participation.


Patient-trial matching algorithm
Eligibility screening
Geographic and site-level filtering
Recruitment pipeline analytics


Status: Active development.

title: Research
text: My research spans five interconnected themes, united by a commitment to rigorous methodology, patient-centered design, and translational impact.

title: Research
text:
Autonomic Disorders
Understanding the mechanisms and improving the diagnosis and management of autonomic nervous system dysfunction in children and adults.


Autonomic Lab — Core research laboratory for autonomic function testing, including cardiovascular autonomic reflex testing, tilt-table studies, and quantitative sudomotor axon reflex testing
ARRO Study — Investigating autonomic regulation and outcomes
MRI POTS — Neuroimaging study of postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome
PWS ANS — Autonomic dysfunction in Prader-Willi Syndrome
Long COVID MRI Study — Characterizing autonomic and neurological sequelae of post-acute COVID-19
ANS Bayesian Analysis — Developing Bayesian statistical methods for autonomic data

title: Research
text:
Rare Pediatric Diseases
Advancing diagnosis and treatment for children with rare neurological and metabolic conditions through clinical trials and collaborative networks.


TaurineLC — Phase II clinical trial of taurine supplementation for long-chain fatty acid oxidation disorders (LCFAO), including a pediatric extension study
RareKidsCan — National rare pediatric diseases research network building collaborative infrastructure for multi-site rare disease trials
Gene Therapy Initiative — Emerging gene therapy research in pediatric neurological conditions
CLCN Pediatric Taurine Trial — Engagement with Canadian Lifelong Conditions Networks for pediatric taurine trial expansion

title: Research
text:
Headache & Migraine
Clinical and epidemiological research in pediatric and adult headache disorders, including clinical trials and real-world evidence studies.


AbbVie Atogepant Trial — Clinical trial of atogepant for migraine prevention
Pfizer Rimegepant Trial — Clinical trial of rimegepant for migraine treatment
Botox Chronic Migraine RWE — Real-world evidence study of botulinum toxin for chronic migraine
MRI Migraine — Neuroimaging in migraine
Cochrane Migraine Systematic Review — Systematic review of migraine interventions
Enrichment Trial Designs — Methods manuscript on enrichment designs for headache trials

title: Research
text:
Clinical Trials Methodology
Developing and validating novel methods for designing, conducting, and analyzing clinical trials — with a focus on efficiency, adaptive designs, and equity.


SHIELD Study — Clinical methodology study
MOSAIC Study — Multi-site methodology study
Diversity in Clinical Trials — Research on equity, diversity, and inclusion in trial recruitment and design
AI-Enhanced Clinical Trial Data Strategy — Developing AI approaches to improve trial data quality and efficiency
Enrichment Trial Designs — Methodological framework for enrichment strategies in clinical trials
CIHR Grant Success Analysis — Analyzing factors that predict grant success at CIHR

title: Research
text:
Health Data & AI
Leveraging health data platforms, AI/NLP tools, and analytics to accelerate research and improve institutional decision-making.


PrairiesCan Health Data Platform — Provincial health data platform initiative
Data Alberta Initiative — Provincial data strategy for health research
AegisText / Janus — AI-powered text analysis and NLP pipeline for clinical documents
Bayesian Deep Learning — Exploring Bayesian neural network methods for clinical prediction
CIHR FDD Analysis — Analysis of CIHR Funding Decisions Database

title: Clinical Trials
text: Alberta has the talent, the patients, and the institutional will to become a national leader in clinical trials. What has been missing is the connective infrastructure — the systems, metrics, and coordination that turn individual site activity into a cohesive provincial engine. That is what I am building.

title: Clinical Trials
text:
The Refocus Initiative
Refocus Clinical Trials is the parent strategic initiative driving clinical trials acceleration in Alberta. It is an integrated program that connects infrastructure investment, technology platforms, national partnerships, and methodology expertise into a single coherent vision.
Refocus encompasses several interconnected projects:

CFI-CTAP — the primary infrastructure grant vehicle
Alberta FAST — the provincial acceleration framework
Metricis — the analytics platform providing real-time trial metrics
Methodology programs — enrichment designs, adaptive trials, AI-enhanced data strategies

title: Clinical Trials
text:
CFI-CTAP
The Clinical Trials Acceleration Platform (CFI-CTAP) is a major Canada Foundation for Innovation infrastructure grant application designed to build the physical and digital infrastructure needed to run clinical trials faster, more efficiently, and at greater scale across Alberta.
CFI-CTAP supports:

Shared clinical trial infrastructure across Edmonton and Calgary
Technology platforms for trial operations (Catalyst, Metricis)
Data integration and analytics capabilities
Training and capacity-building for clinical trial personnel

title: Clinical Trials
text:
Alberta FAST
Alberta FAST (Facilitated Access to Studies and Trials) is a sub-initiative within Refocus aimed at streamlining the pathway from trial concept to patient enrollment. Alberta FAST addresses the operational bottlenecks — contract negotiation, ethics review timelines, site activation — that slow trial startup.

title: Clinical Trials
text:
National Partnerships

NACTRC
The Northern Alberta Clinical Trials and Research Centre (NACTRC) is the regional clinical trials network connecting sites, sponsors, and researchers across northern Alberta. I serve on the NACTRC board and contribute to strategic direction, technology integration, and site development.


PrimeSite
PrimeSite is an NACTRC initiative to position Alberta’s clinical trial sites as preferred partners for industry-sponsored trials through standardized quality metrics, responsive site activation, and competitive feasibility data.

title: Clinical Trials
text:
Trial Methodology
Across all of these initiatives, I maintain an active research program in clinical trial methodology itself:

Enrichment trial designs — using patient selection strategies to improve trial efficiency and reduce sample sizes
Adaptive trial methods — Bayesian and response-adaptive approaches to trial design
AI-enhanced trial data — developing NLP and machine learning tools to improve data quality, site monitoring, and signal detection
Diversity in clinical trials — research on improving equity, diversity, and inclusion in trial recruitment, particularly for Indigenous communities and underrepresented populations

title: Clinical Trials
text:
Clinical Trials Funding
I contribute to broader efforts to expand clinical trials funding in Canada:

Clinical Trials Funding Expansion Initiative — strategic initiative to increase federal and provincial investment in clinical trial infrastructure
Tri-Agency Success Initiative — institutional program to improve success rates on Tri-Council grant competitions
Kaye Innovation Fund — letter of intent for the Kaye Edmonton Clinic Research Fund

title: Clinical Trials
text:
Vision
The goal is not more trials. It is better trials — faster to activate, more efficient to run, more representative of the patients they serve, and more impactful in their outcomes. Alberta can be the province that demonstrates how a coordinated, technology-enabled clinical trials ecosystem works.

title: About
text:
I am a pediatric neurologist, clinician-scientist, and Associate Dean (Research) in the College of Health Sciences at the University of Alberta. My work sits at the intersection of clinical medicine, research strategy, and systems design — building infrastructure that helps researchers and clinicians translate discoveries into better patient outcomes.


As Associate Dean (Research), I oversee research strategy, funding development, and infrastructure across the College of Health Sciences. This includes:

Clinical Research Institute (CRI) — strategic direction and operational oversight for institutional clinical research
AI + Health Hub — co-leading the University’s initiative to embed artificial intelligence in health research
Kipnes Research Institute — contributing to the launch and strategic planning of this new research institute
Research Hubs — oversight of the Regenerative Medicine Hub, Healthy Aging Hub, and Collective Health Research Hub




I serve on numerous institutional, provincial, and national committees that shape research policy and infrastructure:
National

NACTRC (Northern Alberta Clinical Trials and Research Centre) — Board member
CANTRAIN — Canadian clinical trials training network
CIHR College of Reviewers — peer review for clinical trial grants
ACRC Executive Committee — Alberta Clinical Research Consortium

Institutional

Council of Associate Deans Research (CADR)
University Research Advisory Committee (URAC)
University Research Infrastructure Advisory Committee (URIAC)
Centers and Institutes Committee
Research Technology Steering Committee (RTSC)
Future Impact Council of the Stollery (FICS)
Kaye Fund Steering Committee
IPG Infrastructure Working Group
Strategic Research Investment Program (SRIP)
Clinical Trials Advisory Committee (CTAC)
Digital Health Working Group
Data Safety Monitoring Board (DSMB)




I maintain an active clinical practice in pediatric neurology at the Stollery Children’s Hospital, with subspecialty expertise in:

Autonomic disorders — including POTS, autonomic neuropathies, and dysautonomia
Headache medicine — pediatric and adolescent migraine, chronic daily headache
Rare neurological diseases — metabolic and genetic conditions affecting the nervous system

I also provide medico-legal expert opinions for the Canadian Medical Protective Association (CMPA) in pediatric neurology.



Teaching is central to my academic identity. I contribute through:

Hybrid Pediatric Neurology Case Rounds
Neuroscience Grand Rounds
Neuro 210 — medical school neuroscience teaching
Clinical Trials Workshop — methodology education for trainees and faculty
Direct supervision of graduate students and research trainees (see Team)





MD — University of Alberta
FRCPC — Pediatric Neurology, Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Canada
Fellowship training in pediatric neurology with subspecialty focus in autonomic disorders and headache medicine
